pros: Worked for many years, big family
cons: Stand alone hospital, not really financially stable

pros:
Close to home.
Plenty of staff parking.
Smaller facility, comfortable atmosphere.
1199SEIU benefits.
cons:
Poor reputation among medical professionals.
Short staffing is constant.
Management doesn't value the staff.
Low pay. RUMC pays less than other area hospitals.
Building is very old, needs major renovations.
advice_to_mgmt: RUMC doesn't have enough staffing in many departments, and very few people applying for open positions due to the pay offered. Rather than worrying so much about looking for nonexistent "patterns" when employees use their approved sick days, or whether someone takes an extra few minutes on their lunch break, management should be looking into the real issues. You just lost the affiliation with Mt. Sinai, and no other hospitals are rushing to partner with us. Worry about that for a while.

pros: Staff feels like family. New member, are welcome when they present.
cons: Leadership and executive management do not consider the staff or patient needs. Their only worry is staying budget neutral.
advice_to_mgmt: Listen to the front runners. The staff has great ideas. Sometimes a fresh idea can spiral you into great directions.

pros: Co-Workers are very nice people.
cons: No room for advancement, no yearly raises at all, and a lot of office politics.

pros: Nice environment to work in.
cons: None I can identify at the moment

pros: The benefits are good and the people who work at RUMC are great.
cons:
No yearly raises at all for employees
No path for professional growth available in most cases
A lot of office politics
Major leaks / power outages almost every time it rains
Mold in multiple areas of the hospital
No budget available to move forward
advice_to_mgmt: Show some appreciation for the hard working employees at RUMC and maybe turnover would not be as high.

pros: We are a caring team of health Care works that work hard to please our Staten Island Residents
cons: We are a small intity that would be excellent if we was a lot bigger than we are

pros: Benefits, hours available, commute isn't bad
cons:
This company is an exhausting nightmare to work for. Get every single thing they say to you in writing, because they'll turn around and do the opposite. Promised raises never happen, promised coverage never appears, they say they'll train you and it never actually happens. Support staff are treated terribly and overworked, physicians are downright abusive at times to both staff and patients. Complaints to management â€¦ 



Show More
advice_to_mgmt: Consider that it'll save you money in the long term to hire more people for good quality care, rather than work one or two people to the bone and risk mistakes/money loss/poor quality of care.

pros: good commute if you live on staten island
cons: Management is unprofessional and workers feel oppressed if they are not part of the "in- crowd", consisting of multiple family members working in the same place, even in the same department! Management lets go of good employees to hire their friends and families. Unqualified professional staff based on nepotism. Miserable work environment.
advice_to_mgmt: This hospital could be great if it stopped putting people in place who are unqualified to be in managerial positions. Most of them have online degrees and no experience.

pros: One of only two hospitals in the area
cons: company is a revolving door and very cliquish

pros: Lots of opportunity to learn and grow professionally
cons: IT department is understaffed and poorly managed.
advice_to_mgmt: Better hands on management and more adequately staffed

pros: This organization feels like a family. Co workers are warm and hepful
cons: The blessing is the curse. Sometimes family members act up!
advice_to_mgmt: Need better time management with meetings

pros: Decent salary. Fixed schedule, friendly coworkers
cons: Dull hospital, outdated building and elevators and medical equipment, short staffed

pros: I worked there for over 3 years since 2012. it was good experience to work there. all stuffs are kind and knowledgeable. The entire working environment is very pleasant.
cons: nothing is really bad there.

review_title: Wonderful experience to be in. While you work, you learn.
years_at_company: Wonderful experience to be in. While you work, you learn.
pros: Comfortable atmosphere, great pay, good benefits
cons: No problem at this time.

pros: Very family oriented. Employers are very understanding of needing to take time off. Love my coworkers.
cons: Salaries are very low. RUMC needs to revise their salary scales. Not an easy job. Understaffed.

pros: work schedule is flexible
cons: know problems with employment at this time

pros: Good pay, flexible scheduling, convenient location
cons: Gap in communication with staffing coordinator, lack of interest in new hires
advice_to_mgmt: Reach out to per DIEM staff before terminating for not "meeting on call requirements". We are human.

pros: nice and comfortable atmosphere
cons: no complaints at this time

pros: good support for Trauma service, energetic personnel
cons: financially limited, administration tends to fall back on previously lucrative areas of growth as opposed to looking at current areas of growth
advice_to_mgmt: need to invest in growth sections of hospital as opposed to what has been successful in the past

pros: I feel some of the best reasons to work for Richmond University is I gained so much knowledge, with hands on experience and I also worked with so many talented co-workers that I call family.
cons: I have to say the staff except for hand full is like a revolving door, after a year so many nurses leave because we are always under staffed.

pros: I enjoy my profession and my place of employment. Everyday is a learning experience , I enjoy helping others and I have supportive co workers. We are all like family.
cons: There really is no downside. I can not say anything negative

pros: Because this is a local community hospital it has a family like atmosphere. The new CEO is visible and cares about all employees. He is committed to making the organization a leader in caring for the Staten Island Community
cons: Older facility that needs TLC but things are definitely looking up.

pros: It has a good community feel. Excellent education environment, and more than enough surgical cases.
cons: Small residency means the work load is heavy and long hours.

pros: Very good union & health benefits
cons: I don't think I have any cons

pros: It's a Union position with great benefits through 1199.
cons: A LOT OF FAVORITISM AND CLICKS.
advice_to_mgmt: Don't get involved with the clicks and do your job and nothing else to avoid being repromanded by administration in case something goes wrong. They will state that it was not a part of your job.

pros: It was a great place to do my practicum while in college. I learn a lot working in the medical record department.
cons: The only downsize is that I was only there for a short period of time. I feel like it would be a wonderful place to work.

pros: Staff was helpful and seemed to be very knowledgeable.
cons: facility could be more updated, but its clear they are trying to update as they go.

pros: Close to home, location, good atmosphere to work in, everyone is treated like family
cons: Only part time positions are offered

pros: Nice environment people are nice
cons: Under staff they need to hire more people.

cons: Understaffed as far as Nurse Aides, therefore there's always opportunity for extra work.

pros: Family and Doctor friendly environment.

advice_to_mgmt: Get grants from government. Build new ED.

pros: Very busy, great experience, have to learn quickly, fast paced and very heavy work load
cons: disorganized, not up to date on technology. a very fast paced environment that is not meant for everybody. leadership is lacking
